field.name: summary
field.value: ContextBoundObject's context is not bound when object is created by MicroKernel

field.name: description
field.value:
Assume we have service A registered in MicroKernel, we are now in some Context (System.Threading.Thread.CurrentContext) other than DefaultContext. We then Container.Resolve () service A, so that MicroKernel creates object of type A (for simplicity, let A be Transient, but I am trying to create PerContext lifestyle). Constructor of the object still shows, that we are in different context. Later, when we are in DefaultContext, we call a method of the service. If Context is bound properly to the object, CurrentContext should change, but it doesn't.
The problem is probably that the object is not activated properly. I see these lines in DefaultComponentActivator.cs:
ConstructorInfo cinfo = implType.GetConstructor( BindingFlags.Public|BindingFlags.Instance, null, signature, null);
instance = System.Runtime.Serialization.FormatterServices.GetUninitializedObject(implType);
cinfo.Invoke(instance, arguments);
Usual new() on ContextBoundObjects assigns context with the object, what is not happening here.
Also, look at this:
http://msdn2.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.runtime.serialization.formatterservices.getuninitializedobject.aspx
"You cannot use the GetUninitializedObject method to create instances of types that derive from the ContextBoundObject class."
Is there some way to make MicroKernel working with ContextBoundObjects?
Thanks,
Jan
